work.label: JustGiving - feed
work.title: Justgiving's social feed
work.description: Working as the sole frontend resource on the JG home feed I built many of the UI elements within it. I worked with 8-12 colleagues in a cross-functional team of designers, developers and analysts. The page receives around 1.6 million page views per month.

work.label: JustGiving - homepage
work.title: Justgiving's landing page
work.description: Again working as the only frontend developer I built JustGiving's homepage, which receives over 30K unique visitors every day. Alongside C# developers, data scientists and designers we focussed on quick iteration and continuous integration.

work.label: Kaleidoscope Communications
work.title: A communications consultancy
work.description: I implemented the design and build of Kaleidoscope Communications company website. The aim was to describe the company, provide information, display testimonials relating to their work and ultimately direct users to get in touch.

work.label: Heaven Sent Cards
work.title: An e-commerce postcard website
work.description: I was responsible for the management and build of the website along with two other developers and a designer. The website has a gallery to display postcards and also an option to buy them via Paypal.

work.label: OfficeServe
work.title: An online food ordering company
work.description: Myself and one other frontend developer built OfficeServe’s e-commerce platform from scratch. The site includes registration and login using Amazon’s Cognito SDK, a full checkout, a payment service and also product listings. We built the site using some of the latest tech: React, Redux, ES6 and Webpack.

work.label: FIXR
work.title: An student ticketing company
work.description: As the sole frontend developer at Fixr, I own the full development process from code up to production. The isomorphic React application uses server side rendering to improve page load times and search indexing. It also uses Redux, Redux-form, SASS and Webpack.
